perturbation.original_text:
1. Net Investment Income Maintenance.



1.1 Net Investment Income. "Fund Investment Income", as defined in paragraph 1.2 below, minus "Fund Operating Expenses" as defined  in paragraph 1.3 below equals Net Investment Income. If the Fund's Net Investment Income on any day is below zero, the Investment  Adviser shall waive its Advisory Fee or reimburse the Fund an amount (defined as "Expense Waiver") sufficient to produce a Net  Investment Income of zero.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Net Investment Income Maintenance.



1.1 Net Investment Income. "Fund Investment Income", as defined in paragraph 1.2 below, minus "Fund Operating Expenses" as defined  in paragraph 1.3 below equals Net Investment Income. If the Fund's Net Investment Income on any day is below zero, the Investment  Adviser may, at its discretion, waive its Advisory Fee or reimburse the Fund an amount (defined as "Expense Waiver").
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the *requirement* for the Investment Adviser to waive its advisory fee or reimburse the fund when the Net Investment Income is below zero. This introduces a legal risk because the original agreement guarantees a minimum Net Investment Income of zero, protecting investors. Removing this guarantee could be seen as a breach of fiduciary duty, especially if it leads to investor losses.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Investment Company Act of 1940 - Section 36(b) which imposes a fiduciary duty on investment advisers.

perturbation.original_text: 1.5 Right of Recovery. The Investment Adviser shall have the option to recover the full amount waived, paid or reimbursed (the Expense  Waiver) by the Investment Adviser on any day on which the Fund's Net Investment Income exceeds zero. In no event, however, shall  the Expense Waiver, or any portion thereof, constitute an obligation of the Fund to the Investment Adviser on any such day unless  the Investment Adviser has expressly exercised its right to recover all or a portion of the Expense Waiver on that day, in which case  such portion of the Expense Waiver elected by the Investment Adviser for recovery that day shall then be due and payable. If, and to  the extent, the payment by the Fund to the Investment Adviser of the Expense Waiver would cause the Fund's Net Investment Income  to fall below zero, such payment shall be deferred until such date on which the
perturbation.changed_text: 1.5 Right of Recovery. The Investment Adviser may have the option to recover the amount waived, paid or reimbursed (the Expense  Waiver) by the Investment Adviser on any day on which the Fund's Net Investment Income exceeds zero. The Expense Waiver, or any portion thereof, may constitute an obligation of the Fund to the Investment Adviser. The Fund may determine when to pay the Investment Adviser the Expense Waiver.
perturbation.explanation: This modification weakens the Investment Adviser's right to recover waived expenses. By changing 'shall have the option to recover the full amount' to 'may have the option to recover the amount', and removing the conditions under which the Expense Waiver becomes an obligation and outlining conditions under which payment will be deferred, the contract becomes less favorable to the Investment Adviser and introduces ambiguity regarding reimbursement. This could violate the principle of fair dealing as it pertains to fund management, particularly concerning reimbursement for expenses incurred to maintain fund performance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Investment Advisers Act of 1940 - Section 206, which prohibits investment advisers from engaging in fraudulent or deceptive practices.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period of one year from the date of its execution and from year to year thereafter provided such  continuance is specifically approved by a majority of the trustees of the Trust who (i) are not "interested persons" of the Trust or any other party  to this Agreement, as defined in the 1940 Act, and (ii) have no direct or indirect financial interest in the operation of this Agreement ("Non- Interested Trustees"). This Agreement will terminate upon the termination of the Advisory Agreement except the Investment Adviser's Right of  Recovery set forth in section 1.5 herein.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period of one year from the date of its execution and from year to year thereafter. This Agreement will terminate upon the termination of the Advisory Agreement except the Investment Adviser's Right of  Recovery set forth in section 1.5 herein.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for approval by a majority of disinterested trustees for the agreement's continuance. This creates a conflict with the Investment Company Act of 1940, which emphasizes independent oversight of fund management to protect shareholder interests. By eliminating the need for disinterested trustee approval, the contract weakens investor protection by removing an important check on potential conflicts of interest.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Investment Company Act of 1940 - Section 15(c), which requires disinterested trustee approval of investment advisory agreements.
